problem_text:
Suppose that G is a triply transitive group in which a stabilizer of two points
contains no involutions, and a stabilizer of three points is trivial. Is it true that G
is similar to PGL2(P) in its natural action on the projective line P ∪ {∞}, for some
field P of characteristic 2? This is true under the condition that the stabilizer of two
points is periodic.
V. D. Mazurov
